title: Allow custom serial monitor baud option
Relicense under MIT and Apache-2.0
body: Relicensing the espflash project under MIT and Apache-2.0 licenses as agreed on #224

title: Add option --bin for choosing one binary when there are more than one binaries
body:
A beginner in esp decided to build several slightly different binaries by placing the source codes in `src/bin` in the same project. The following error message is produced when the binary to flash is not specified:

```
 Error: cargo_espflash::multiple_artifacts
 
   × Failed to build project
   ╰─▶ Multiple build artifacts found
  help: Please specify which artifact to flash using --bin
```

Running `cargo espflash --bin myapp1 /dev/ttyACM0` doesn't seem to solve it, though, with this message:

```
error: Found argument '--bin' which wasn't expected, or isn't valid in this context

      If you tried to supply `--bin` as a value rather than a flag, use `-- --bin`
```

This commit adds the option `--bin` to build_options, which has worked in my case.

title: Check (and display) app vs partition size before flashing
Move the bootloaders and stubs into a common resources directory, update dependencies
Allow skipping the padding for image files
body:
Currently `espflash` creates a 16MB image when specifying a flash size of 16MB. When mass producing devices a flash size of 16MB significantly slows down the flashing process without any benefit.

In order to not break backwards compatibility and expectations a new command line switch has been introduced `--skip-padding`, which reduces the image size to only what is really used.

title: Add support for erasing otadata
body:
Closes #119

This PR adds a `--erase-otadata` argument when flashing.

This will force using stub since it's using the `ERASE_REGION` command.
I also implemented the `ERASE_FLASH` command but didn't do any particular test nor did I implement an argument switch to use it.

I guess implementing two other commands for both `ERASE_REGION` and `ERASE_FLASH` would make sense, but having a first support for erasing the otadata partition thus allowing to reflash the chip after an OTA update seems more of a priority.

title: Add support for flashing S2 via CDC UART
Fix workaround causing corruption of segment length
body:
Fixes the issue described in #225

This took way too long to figure out, but currently `espflash` appends a workaround padding without actually increasing the segment size - this causes the following segments to become corrupted (as their header is moved back and 0s are inserted).

See original python code for reference (this PR makes the Rust code correctly resemble the python code):
https://github.com/espressif/esptool/blob/b37496f86ddd74a850533401067fd5054a746824/esptool/bin_image.py#L738-L748

Closes #225

title: Wait for FlashDeflateEnd ack
body:
When using the stub, the data sent in FlashDeflateData is not actually
written to flash until after the ack is sent by the stub. Waiting for
FlashDeflateEnd ensures that all data sent during with FlashDeflateData
has been fully written.

title: Add support for custom partition types and sub-types
body:
Adds support for custom partition types and sub-types. Refer to the ESP-IDF partition table documentation for more information on these:  
https://docs.espressif.com/projects/esp-idf/en/latest/esp32/api-guides/partition-tables.html

@ollpu would you be able to test out this PR and confirm it is working for you, please?

Closes #219

title: bugfix: Don't use canonicalized strings on Windows
body: closes #209

title: Fix sync behavior
body: This change fixes how the sync responses are read. 8 responses with the SYNC op should be read in total. Without doing this it was occasionally possible to have a SYNC response bleed into subsequent response reads resulting in failures. This was notably seen in RegRead when reading the MAGIC value just after performing the initial connection and sync.

title: enable support for loader stubs (via --use-stub arg)
body:
adds a rough impl for loading flash stubs into ram towards #215 (and https://github.com/esp-rs/esp-idf-template/issues/48), enabled with the `--use-stub` argument so this is a strictly opt-in addition and doesn't change existing behaviour.

(for some reason `ConnectOpts` is part of `main::Opts` and `Subcommand::(BoardInfo|SerialMonitor)` which can be a bit confusing / seems like it should only be in the root?)

tested `board-info` and flashing with on my `esp32-pico-v3`:


title: Check if a new version if available upon invocation
body:
Checks [crates.io](https://crates.io) for a new version at the time of invocation, and prints a message to the user if an update is available.

You can test locally by hard-coding in a version below `1.6.0`.

title: Bump dependencies and fix resulting build errors
Consistently support binary partition tables
body: Fixes #211.

title: Fix direct-boot image check for ESP32-S3
body: Unlike the ESP32-C3 the magic bytes to identify a direct-boot image is at offset 0x400 for ESP32-S3.

title: Add `serial-monitor` subcommand
body:
Include `serial-monitor` subcommand in `cargo-espflash` and `espflash` to allow monitoring a serial monitor without flashing.
Closes #197

title: Add support for flashing the ESP32-C2 (aka ESP8684)
body: Additionally does some refactoring to reduce duplication.

title: Update `crossterm` and remove the temporary bugfix from our monitor
body: Confirmed that the monitor still works on macOS after these changes. @bjoernQ would you be able to test this out on Windows when you get a chance please? (No rush)

title: Allow hex or decimal addresses to be passed to the write bin subcommand
body: Closes #201

title: Use `read_to_end` to eliminate partial reads
Add "write-bin-to-flash" subcommand
body: This subcommand adds support for writing a binary file at a specific address in flash.

title: Include the base address of the RTC peripheral when disabling the RTC WDT
body:
Closes [#126 ](https://github.com/esp-rs/espflash/issues/171)

Interestingly even though flashing now succeeds, the application doesn't seem to start - I'm not sure if this is just my devkit though.

title: Remove dependency to FirmwareImage from flash_targets
body:
I am looking into using espflash as an API to flash a single binary file like the `phy_init_data.bin`.

Currently, the flash_targets depend on a `FirmwareImage` which requires to have loaded a valid ELF file. The `FlashTarget` is currently only used to get the entrypoint for the `RamTarget`. This PR makes the entrypoint specific to the `RamTarget` and makes the `FlashTarget` trait more generic for other use-cases.

title: Introduce FirmwareImage trait
body: This PR makes `FirmwareImage` a trait and moves the original implementation to `ElfFirmwareImage` so that formats other than ELF could be supported. Additionally, flash parameters are decoupled from `FirmwareImage`.

title: Pass-through --target-dir to cargo
body: Short and sweet.

title: Detect the bootloader and partition table from ESP-IDF when able
body:
Closes #185 

When the `esp-idf-sys` package is built, we store the paths to the already-compiled `bootloader.bin` and `partition-table.bin` files. If no alternatives have been specified via either command-line arguments and/or Cargo package metadata, then these binaries will be used instead of the defaults included with `espflash`.

When users are _not_ building `esp-idf-sys`, (ie. bare-metal) then the behaviour does not change.

@MabezDev @bjoernQ @ivmarkov @n3xed will this cause any issues which I have not thought of?

title: CI Add workflow for building artifatcs for armv7 and aarch64 linux
body:
closes #170 

This PR builds artifacts for cargo-espflash and espflash for Linux armv7 and armv7 (aarch68).
I wasn't successful with [cross](https://github.com/cross-rs/cross).

title: remove hyphen from chip string
body: esptool uses the chip name _without_ the hypen, e.g esp32c3 instead of esp32-c3. I see no reason not to do the same here, typing a hyphen is annoying :D.

title: Make all library modules public
body:
I'm trying to use espflash as library and needed to open up espflash a lil bit :D. Is there any reason not to do this? 

Also snuck in a trait bound on `ImageFormat` to make `dyn ImageFormat` `Send`able across threads, happy to open another PR if that's more suitable!

Edit: If this seems like a reasonable idea lmk and I'll fix the clippy issues.

title: Add --locked and --frozen options
body: These are easy to support but important to ensure reproducibility and as such are a must for production deployments of modern firmware. :)

title: bugfix: flash with wsl2
body:
Closes #166 

Note: It is not possible to flash `usb-serial-jtag` chips with `WSL2` because the reset also resets `serial-jtag-peripheral` which disconnects the chip from WSL2.

title: canonicalize the serial path
body: Closes #177

title: Update README.md
body: Typo, getting "Error: × invalid type: map, expected a sequence for key `usb_device` at line 4 column 1" otherwise

title: Add partition-table subcommand
body:
Fixes #165 and fixes #163. It's quite pretty too:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1664/166118910-8050a029-be9f-47bb-bd2d-6760e4eec690.png)

This is quite a bit more than I bargained for but I think this makes sense as parsing of the binary stuff is also in esp-idf's `gen_esp32part.py` and that's Python so we can't have that!

I had to bump the MSRV to 1.58 but I hope that's ok.

title: Hack to disable the rtc watchdog when connecting under the usb-serial-jtag
body:
When the chip is reset via the USB-SERIAL-JTAG not everything is fully reset, the RTC domain stays active. Therefore, if the RTC watchdog is enabled before being put into download mode it will trigger when flashing, hence resetting the board and interrupting flashing.

The reason it always works on Arduino is that the RTC watchdog is explicitly disabled very early on in the boot process which doesn't seem to be the case for normal esp-idf applications, and therefore Rust applications. 

Closes #154

title: Build release artifacts for additional targets
body: Closes #144

title: fix bug #149
body:
I have same issue, fixed by add a line in  espflash/src/connection.rs:93 add sleep 10ms.
In my MacBook Pro 12.3.1, It's test OK.

title: Fix parsing for multiple features
body: Fixes #161.

title: Refactor merge option a bit
body:
I think the earlier way the merge option was implemented was a bit surprising to the user and entirely undocumented in that. It created a new file `_merged` instead of the actual given path name. I think if a user provides `--merge` with a `file`, that `file` being the merged file is the expected outcome.

This refactors the merge functionality while providing a clear separation in terms of code paths for merged and unmerged paths while being overall less complex and less code to maintain.

This also fixes #159.

title: Correct path extension checks for cargo package metadata
body:
This was accidentally broken (by me) in a previous refactor.

The fields for these paths were originally `String` but were changed to `PathBuf`. Unfortunately both types have an `ends_with` function (but they behave differently), so this was not caught by the compiler.

See https://github.com/esp-rs/espflash/issues/156 for further context.

title: bugfix: fix reset sequence for usb-serial-jtag chips
body:
Small refactor of @bjoernQ's workaround in #153. 

Closes #153

title: Feature: add subcommand for merging binaries
body:
Feature: add the option for merging bootloader, partition-table and application binary into a single binary.
Closes #79 

Note: To get a chip revision, the connection is needed, for simplicity, the revision None is used.

title: Scale the app partition based on flash size.
body:
The pre-defined `app_sizes` for the various `Esp32Param` assume a flash size which is not necessarily correct, e.g. there are esp32-c3 chips with 2MB. 

This pull request removes the need to supply a custom partition-table for those chips.

title: Replace our naive monitor with espmonitor
body:
Draft as we need a new release of espmonitor once https://github.com/esp-rs/espmonitor/pull/41 is merged, but feel free to try it out.

One thing to note is that we can not longer control the output to the terminal, so I've removed the line_endings module, if we need this we should PR it to espmonitor.

Closes #147

title: Apply a temporary fix to the serial monitor to make Ctrl-c work again
body: Fixes #143

title: Customize firmware image header
body:
This PR now updates the boot loader header _and_ the app image header only when a user supplies override via the `-s`, `-m` and `-f` flags. 

If no overrides are provided, the header is extracted from the esp-idf bootloader, and the same settings are used for the app header, by doing this we allow esp-idf SDKCONFIG settings to work seamlessly with espflash.

Closes https://github.com/esp-rs/espflash/issues/140

title: Re-work the serial error types to make the problem more clear
body:
Previously there was a single error variant for serial related problems, `NoSerial`, which did not necessarily describe the problem. This PR has re-worked the serial related error handling to hopefully better describe what went wrong. While I was at it I did some cleanup which (IMO) makes parts of this code a bit more readable/understandable.

Is this new approach adequate? Are there any other cases which may require an additional error variant?
